meanings.sent1: When the magician waved his wand, the rabbit materialises out of thin air.
meanings.sent2: The dream of traveling the world slowly materialises into a plan.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a talking dog materialises in a hilarious cartoon.
meanings.sent4: Hope materialises like a bright light in the darkness of despair.
meanings.sent5: The concept of time materialises as the ticking of a clock.

meanings.sent1: As the fog lifted, the outline of the ship materialises on the horizon.
meanings.sent2: The stars materialise in the night sky as the sun sets.
meanings.sent3: The ghost materialises in the old mansion, surprising the visitors.
meanings.sent4: The truth materialises like a hidden message revealed under a UV light.
meanings.sent5: The rainbow materialises after the rain, painting the sky with colors.

meanings.definition: To take on a physical form
meanings.sent1: The robot materialises as the engineers assemble its parts.
meanings.sent2: The virtual world materialises into a tangible experience through virtual reality goggles.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's powers materialise when he puts on his costume.
meanings.sent4: The memories materialise as vivid images in the old photo album.
meanings.sent5: The sculpture materialises from a block of marble under the skilled hands of the artist.
